BookGuide:
Search with Virgin Atlantic
 
1. Create a free account with Virgin and search on Virgin's website.
2. Select "Flexible Dates" and choose to show price in "Points." You may need to select your airports from the "Full Airport List."
3. Select "Upper Class" and the total number of passengers.
4. After searching, click "Price Calendar" to maximize the dates viewable.
5. Filter for "Direct" flights.
 
Search one-way flights to start. Once you find availability in each direction, then search & book those dates roundtrip. You'll need to search roundtrip from U.S. to Lima in order to find availability on flights from Lima back to the U.S. Read our guide. If you see Virgin's new homepage design, select the "Reward flights" tab to start.
 
If you’re just opening a Virgin account, it may take 24-72 hours to get verified so you can book. Call Virgin (800-862-8621) & ask if they can hold seats until then. ATL-LIM flights won't appear on Virgin's monthly calendar - use Alaska's search tool.
 
Booking with Alaska
 
1. Search and book on Alaskaair.com by selecting "Use miles."
2. After searching, click "View by calendar" to maximize the dates viewable.
3. Filter results for "Business" class. Alaska's calendar view may also show connecting flights on American - those don't have lie-flat seats. Click through to check if there are nonstop LATAM flights available.
4. When choosing flights, filter for "Nonstop" and "LATAM."
 
Booking with British Airways
 
1. Create a free British Airways account. You must have an account to search.
2. Log in, choose "Business" & the total number of travelers.
3. Search for the exact dates where you found availability via Virgin or Alaska.
 
Transfers are usually instant but in some cases there are delays. If you're just opening a new loyalty account, transfers may take longer.
 
Taxes & fees average ~$50 one-way or $120 roundtrip
Summary:
Tons of availability to fly LATAM business class lie-flat and nonstop to South America! Best availability for 2+ passengers in February - March '25 (peak season). Includes Thanksgiving from ATL, MIA, & NYC to Lima, Christmas/NYE from Miami, and the new route from Orlando to Santiago this summer/fall.

Flights to Lima are flying LATAM's 767-300 which has its best 1-2-1 seating layout. Other flights are aboard a 787 Dreamliner, which has 2-2-2 seating. Pick the middle row of seats so both passengers have direct aisle access.

Fares include priority boarding, checked bags, lie-flat seats, lounge access, biz class meals, and champagne.

Book with Alaska Miles

Alaska charges 35k to 50k miles each way. This is the best deal overall but you can't book flights to GRU or from JFK to LIM using Alaska miles. You may be able to fly from your home airport with a connection in LAX if you live in a West Coast city with Alaska Airlines service. Transfer points from Bilt (usually takes 10 min).




Book with Virgin Points

Virgin charges 50k to 95k points each way. Roundtrip (& one-way) flights from the U.S. to Lima can be booked online. All other routes can be booked one-way or R/T online. You can't book one-way from Lima to the U.S. online but you can call to book those flights one-way.




Transfer points from Amex Membership Rewards, Bilt, Capital One, Chase, or Citi (usually instant). Take advantage of 30% transfer bonuses from Amex & Chase to Virgin, meaning you can book from 39k Amex MR or Chase points each way.


Book with British Airways Avios

British Airways charges 62k to 93k Avios each way on most routes (39k for MIA-LIM). All routes are bookable via BA. Transfer points to BA from Amex MR, Bilt, Capital One, Chase, or Wells Fargo (usually instant). You can also combine BA & Qatar Avios - transfer Citi points to Qatar (1-2 days).
